repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Private Sector and Agriculture
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall ratings are assessed as highly
            unsatisfactory project outcomes, highly unlikely
            sustainability, and negligible institutional development
            impacts, achieved by an unsatisfactory Bank performance and
            a highly unsatisfactory Borrower performance. Institutional
            lessons suggest that financial incentives, and heavy
            reliance on effectiveness, and disbursement conditions,
            require the support of an overriding framework of
            macroeconomic, or sectoral reforms, i.e., broader framework
            for reform of the agricultural, financial, or rural finance
            sectors, to mobilize the support needed to implement
            ambitious reform programs, and, in addition, the existing
            capacity of the implementing agency should be taken into
            consideration early on. Projects designed as a banking
            reform project, should be implemented as such, and not as
            rural credit or rural development project, with the
            appropriate resources and skills mix made available as
            required. Operational lessons reinforce that lack of
            commitment to aspects of projects, should be clearly and
            timely reported by task teams, supervision efforts need to
            re-build project understanding and commitment, and the task
            team should timely, and proactively assess needed corrective
            measures. Supervision efforts should complete project
            preparation, as necessary, before embarking on
            implementation. Moreover, involvement of second tier
            officials in project preparation should protect project
            ownership, and implementation from staff turnover risks,
            while clear project legal documents, and its consistency
            with the appraisal, would help maintain implementation
            momentum, should a high turnover of leadership occur.

5084576.trustfund:
TF037164-EGYPT - PRIVATE SECTOR &
            AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF037489-EGYPT, ARAB REPUBLIC - PRVT.
            SECT. AND AG. DEV.
5084576.majtheme: Rural development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Egypt - Private Sector and Agricultural
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector and Agriculture
            Development Project seeks to support the Government of
            Egypt's continuing policies of encouraging broad-based
            private-sector-led growth in order to meet the need for
            increased employment opportunities and income. Specifically,
            the PSADP aims to promote rural economic development, and
            strengthen financial and institutional viability of the
            Principle Bank for Development and Agricultural Credit
            (PBDAC), the main institution providing financial services
            in rural Egypt. The project has two components. The first
            finances a line of credit covering all categories of
            agricultural and rural investment, including investment in
            such activities as transportation, storage, and trading of
            agricultural inputs or products, irrigation investments,
            small industry and commerce. Permanent working capital is
            eligible for funding when included as part of the costs of
            implementing the investment sub-project. The second
            component, institution building, improves the accounting and
            auditing function of PBDAC by funding preparation and
            implementation of a multi-year audit; assists in improving
            overall operations, and financial management, including
            building the capacity of the planning, personnel, and credit
            functions; and purchasing computer hardware and software to
            improve accounting and financial reporting and to fully
            computerize PBDAC and its affiliates.
